content.en: Missing data imputation: Researchers have been exploring various algorithms to address the challenge of missing data in traffic flow analysis. These algorithms, such as gradient descent, tensor completion, and tensor decomposition, aim to estimate and predict traffic patterns accurately and efficiently. By leveraging spatial and temporal information, these algorithms improve the imputing performance of missing traffic data and enable better coverage of traffic state estimation.
content.da: Imputering af manglende data: Forskere har undersøgt forskellige algoritmer for at tackle udfordringen med manglende data i trafikflowanalyse. Disse algoritmer, såsom gradientnedstigning, tensor-komplettering og tensor-nedbrydning, sigter mod at estimere og forudsige trafikmønstre nøjagtigt og effektivt. Ved at udnytte rumlig og tidsmæssig information forbedrer disse algoritmer imputeringen af manglende trafikdata og muliggør bedre dækning af trafiktilstandsestimering.
